Head to toe assessment 5.) why the ED? 6.) why LIJ? 7.) critical priority question with 4 different patients

Be sure to listen carefully to the questions and answer them honestly and to the best of your ability. It is also important to ask questions of your own to show your interest in the position and the company.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Sonographer/RVT Interview

Very nice quick they did not cause issues in interview fair fair fair fair. Management was many different people and i was able to work with them fast .

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health

Interview Questions: Why do you think you’re capable with this position

title: Senior Product Services and Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter called me with few to no details about what the job entailed or what the hiring managers were looking for. After mentioning I had experience with a scheduling tool they use, I was offered two back-to-back interviews with the two hiring managers. The first one asked me to 'tell me about myself', only to stop me 30 seconds in to ask me 'What job do you think you're applying for?'. That set the tone for the rest of the interview, and immediately laid bare that she hadn't bothered to read my resume before taking an hour of our time. This was made more clear when she explained that she was looking for someone with a patient-facing background working in a medical practice, which I have never set foot inside of as an employee. Overall, the interview was an embarrassing waste of everyone's time and exposed the dumpster fire that is Northwell's talent acquisition process. By the way, I've had a number of similar interview experiences there - this is just the worst one!
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working in medical practices?

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: simple and nice people for interview. Interview was good. Many questions for interesting to answer also. doctors amazing. Nurses were amazing. doctors and nurses were interviewing me. Environment was good also
Interview Questions: why you want to be a MA?

title: Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with HR, with screening questions. She requested I complete an online interview with 5-6 pre recorded questions within the next 48 hours. The questions only allowed one recording, no redos.
Interview Questions: What was your highest acuity patient?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by an internal recruiter for Northwell. I met all qualifications and was very interested. I never heard back from the recruiter and ended up applying on the website. I was rejected without an interview. Now a month later I get an email that I've been added to their "careers" newsletter about their benefits and all of the lovely people who work there. I can't imagine why they think I would want that.
Interview Questions: Did not receive an interview or response from the internal recruiter.

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview was very long. I was interviewed by 6 people for 2 hours. The ask about excel skills, any prior experience and educational background. They appreciate if you ask questions about the job and the company.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with pivot and vlookup

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very easy. I was asked a few questions based on my resume and experience that I had. After answering questions the manager who interviewed me you could tell she was desperate because she told me I was hired and HR would be contacting me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwell?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward screening call with Human Resources. The recruiter stayed in touch over email, but in the end they decided not to fill the role. Process took longer than is should have.
Interview Questions: Q. Why do want this role?

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: This was an interesting one. I interviewed three times and in one met the entire team. Then I was called by the in-house recruiter and told they were not moving forward with me as a candidate and no reason why. Then a week later I received an email from the hiring manager saying they have not made any final decisions and they would be in touch. Apparently lines got crossed and I was rejected a second time. I’ve been in HR for 22 years and never seen anything like this. If you are up for this role I would rethink it. They are obviously extremely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Receptionist Interview

title: Revenue Accountant Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at northwell?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Phenomenal experience during the interview process. You apply via ERAS and then the interview is through Zoom. Starts off with the coordinator setting an amazing environment and all the interviewees getting to introduce one another. Then you go into your private interview rooms for two 15 minute sessions with faculty who are absolutely amazing! Overall they feel like you're chit-chatting with family and it's going to be the best interview experience you'll have. Really feels like they're fun, genuine, loving friends.
Interview Questions: Tell me something interesting about yourself.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Only 2 interviews before they offered the job. Thus, quick turnover however the onboarding process took more than a month but the onboarder was very cooperative. They job offer was very detailed and there was room to negotiate salary.
Interview Questions: Past employement experience and your strength and weakness.

title: Critical Care Fellowship Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview with the manager and assistant nurse manager went well. They were both young and very approachable. However, the fellowship was not explained in detail. It was said to be difficult and "a lot of work", but it was not stated that it would be equivalent to going back to school with the amount of work being done during in-hospital classes, and at home work. Also, it was not mentioned until the end of the class load, that you can fail out of the fellowship, with no guarantee of another placement elsewhere in the hospital. This is a job, not school.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for ICU nursing in the next 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a call the next day. HR scheduled me for the next few days for in-person interview. It was quick and efficient process.

I just had an issue with the interview itself. Three of the RNs in the unit interviewed me. I was doing well with the normal questions then the nurse manager asked a prioritization question. While answering, one of them was making faces and reacting to my first answer saying ‘Ugh’ in a sort of surprised tone. After this, they started losing interest, you can see it with their actions. One tossed my resume on the side after the interview and it was in a Visitor’s Lounge. The whole time I was being interviewed, I see one of them looking at her watch and just straight up making faces with what she read in my resume. I left feeling inadequate and unqualified. I didn’t have an offer yet cause it was just a few days ago. But I asked around and I knew somebody who works in the hospital. They say that they have a high turn over unit in the area because of burnout and the people working there.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself
Why Northwell?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Prioritization question about the patients in unit

I thought I would for sure get the job, but I still haven't heard back from them. I interviewed 3 weeks ago... I sent a thank you AND a follow up email and still no answer. Is this typical for a big company? I'm annoyed it has taken them so long to get back to me; it seems like they are ghosting me.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.

How do you prioritize tasks?

Are you squeamish at all?

Interview Descriptions: I was given a referral and went through multiple rounds of interviews to find a place for myself at the company. I initially met with the VP of tech and moved down the latter until I met my team. There was one technical interview.
Interview Questions: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in early December. Interviewed today , negative experience. I interviewed with both an NP (who was kind), and the doctor who runs the clinic. The doctor blatantly told she does not hire new grads, which left me confused and surprised as my resume clearly states I am a new grad NP. She then told me to look elsewhere to get experience under my belt and started to name hospitals. Very unprofessional and total disrespect to me and my time. The NP offered to forward my resume to other departments that may be looking to hire which I thanked her for. Unfortunately after this experience, I will not take anything that is offered to me at that specific campus. I work for Northwell as an RN and am just taken aback by this.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have? 
Where did you grow up?
What experience do you have with family planning? procedures (colposcopy, IUD etc)

title: Facilities Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Ridiculous.  It was a phone screen which wasted my time and at the very end, she intrusively asked if I took the COVID death jab vax.  I said no and I would have to submit religious exemption.  She said the jab was required and wouldn't even entertain my Civil Rights of religious exemption so they discriminated against me right off the bat based on a vaccination status.
Interview Questions: Did you get the covid vaccine?

title: Emergency Medical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. You end up in front of a supervisor and are asked a series of questions regarding the role you apply for and the supervisor can decide right then and there if you are fit for the role entailed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was not very different from most physician interviews I have had in the past. The process included meeting with the relevant people, discussing your experiences and answering questions about why you'd like to work there , asking about questions about the job responsibilities and expectations and touring the site.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you'd like to work here.

title: Infrastructure Services and Management Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was great, very professional and full of information with the company and the departments within the hospital that the IT dept. is responsible for, I also got a tour of the floor.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my background and how I would be able to multitask. Interview lasted about an hour

title: Grant Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Long Island, ME)
Interview Descriptions: I had a panel interview with several team members. The meeting was via Zoom. In the first part of the interview each person asked me questions. In the second part, I asked them questions. They were friendly and open
Interview Questions: They asked how I designed education

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Worst interview process for IT Project Manager position. The staff member Robert will continue to ask questions with total disregard to allowing the candidate to respond and blame you for not coming fully prepared.

Horrible methods.

Learn to show some respect to candidates and especially people of color.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: EMT-Basic Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and other information on their website under the listing then got a call back. They were friendly, professional, and quick to move forward with next steps. Seems like a great work environment.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place viz zoom, approximately 30 minutes.  I was being interviewed for the float team on a med/surg unit by two nursing managers. Four days after the interview I reached out to the recruiter and was then informed that I did not get the position.
Interview Questions:
Triage five patient scenarios 
how to treat a MI without an MD order in place 
perform a head-to-toe assessment 
tell me about yourself and why you want to work here.

title: Project Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Zoom call with manager & call with director. Asks about prior experiences. Be sure to know excel pivot tables & other functions. Overall, simple & great interview experience. Great way to kick start career

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Mount Kisco, NY) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The woman who interviewed me seemed to be in competition with me and my knowledge. I didn’t feel that she was secure in her own role.  She was talking at me more that listening to me.
Interview Questions: What do you dislike about your current position.

title: FlexStaff Practice Secretary Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy/online/FaceTime. Were flexible with my schedule. When I did not get offered a position for the first job I applied for, the coordinator reached out to me and helped me land a different position.
Interview Questions: What was a situation in my current job that I felt challenged in and how did I handle it.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly awkward and uncomfortable. There were two interviewers, but one of them was "late" whether it was intentional or not. I then had to repeat my answers to the two questions that were asked because the one that was late asked the EXACT same two questions that I had already answered. The two people interviewing me didn't even have their cameras on so I was starting at myself the whole time. Why interview me if you won't even turn on your camera? Seems suspicious. They clearly had no interest and had already found someone so why are you wasting my time and yours. Very unprofessional experience
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will send you interview times - you choose what fits your schedule. You should be prepared to interview with both the director and the supervisor. Also, you should be comfortable with answering clinical scenarios.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy process where the interviewer calls and discusses the position as well as asks very routine interview questions. Enjoyed the interview, very informative. Would recommend interviewing here.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a medical assistant

title: Public Relations Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Somers, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: All of my interviews were done via video conference. This was super convenient and safe especially during a pandemic. The entire process from sending in my initial application and resume to hiring took a little over two months, but that's to be expected.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position and working at Northwell Health?

title: Mss Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. It was pretty easy. I was interviewed by two people but they did not seem engaged or interested in me from the start. One of the people who was supposed to interview me as well, never showed up.
Interview Questions: The questions included strengths and weaknessses, one time you missed a deadline and how you fixed it, what would your previous employer say are your good qualities.

title: Account Patient Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Bay Shore, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met in person, was asked about last experience and education.  Was easy no stress.   The online background work is a lot.  Many links to sign on can’t get very confusing.  Looking forward to working the company.

What experience do I have? 
And what education?

title: Care Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relaxing. I was interviewed by two supervisors of the position. They mainly asked questions as it relates to the position and asked about past experiences. They explained the role and what is expected. They spoke about a typical day on the job. They asked about what I do for self Care and  time management. Asked if I had a vehicle and how I felt about going in people’s homes.
Interview Questions: If a client is being discharged from the hospital and he doesn’t have anywhere to live and also has insurance issues, what would you do first?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: video interview that was sent via email. first asked about introduction and about yourself then 5 other questions were asked such as strengths and weaknesses and why you chose to apply to the job
Interview Questions: introduction interview via video camera

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from their talent recruiter a few days after applying the position asking if I was still interested in the position. The following day , I was asked what interview time worked for me and if a certain day was ok for me , I’m which I replied. She said she would give me a call to finalize a time and place by the next day once my resume is forwarded to a hiring manager (never received a call) . Now here is where I started to get turned off :
The recruiter emailed me the night before ( 7:30pm)  to let me know that I had an interview the NEXT  morning. Extremely last minute .
I arrived to the interview and was told to have a seat along with 2 other candidates. We sat for almost 45 minutes before  someone came out only to tell us that we are waiting for the hiring managers to arrive (lovely). They finally arrive maybe 20 minutes after , no greeting to us , and in a rush like someone just told them the interviews were today . 
After waiting 1 hour for the managers and another hour to be seen , I didn’t end up getting interviewed until 2 hours after my initial slot . And to top it off , it seemed very rushed ! (The nerve) I feel like they wanted to go back to what they were doing since I was last and had no intention of a formal interview with questions and showcasing how my skills align with the position. Completely turned off
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself .
How do you handle difficult situations? 
Are you vaccinated?
How is your time & attendance ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly simple and my interviewer had a great energy. It was professional, but still casual, in that we had a flowing conversation with basic interview questions sprinkled in, as well as expanding on my resume. Just be yourself and know your stuff about the role, the hospital and the interviewer.
Interview Questions:
What inspired you to go into nursing?
What can you bring to our unit?
How do you think you can improve patient satisfaction?

title: Finance Analyst Interview

Interview consisted of three rounds. First round consisted of recorded videos and then second and third was interviews with management.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very good and informative. They presented a good plan with a plan in promoting growth within the company. They made sure you are very comfortable with the questions they ask. Very much a comfortable atmosphere.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Describe a time you had a difficulty pt

title: Licensed Physical Therapist Assistant Interview

title: Senior Business Development Analyst Interview

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2021

Interview Questions: I was looking to transition from one career path to another so most interesting question was why I wanted to change trajectory.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through the website on June 28, received a call July 27 from the recruiter that I was selected for an interview. It was a total of three interviews over 2 weeks (all virtual interviews as I do live locally and will be relocating). 

I met three times total. First, with the Director and team I’d be working with directly. Second with two department heads I would be working with regularly and the last interview was a third department head that couldn’t make the second interview date. 

Great conversations and each person I spoke was easy to talk to and I feel very much at ease in each interview. I revived a call from the recruiter a week after my last interview with an offer,  which was August 25. 

There will be 4 weeks of onboarding, so from application to my start date, it will be 3 months. Well worth the time and patience!
Interview Questions:
Tell Us About Yourself. 

Give me three words that best describes you.

Tell me a time how you dealt with conflict.

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Sent email for position inquiry. Received email back several days later to schedule a zoom interview due to covid 19 restrictions. Interview went well and was emailed application and release forms to move forward completed packet and emailed back. Still waiting for offer or rejection three months later.
Interview Questions: Career background past, life experience .

title: Occupational Therapist Interview

title: EMT-Basic Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

They made me get 5 references and all the proper vaccines before telling me they're not going through with the process. I do not recommend anyone to go through this process. Terrible company!!
Interview Questions: Simple questions about what I've done in my earlier roles. What tools am I familiar with.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 3 months, you have few phone interviews first before they invite you for an in person interview. I did not end up taking the officer but overall very nice experience.

title: Medical Receptionist Interview

title: Echocardiographer Interview

They even called my current manager even though they said they would let me know if and when they would.  I had two more interviews was told someone would call me when a decision was made regardless of outcome  but no one did. My current employer now knows that I was seeking employment elsewhere.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 4 people to see which department would be the best fit. Ended up being called back to interview with a completely different department. Believe it was a miscommunication on their part.

title: Manager Interview

title: Food Service Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: It lasted to 2 hours, I met with upper management in the department. They were very welcoming and I felt very comfortable during the entire process. Interview Questions: Why did I decide to work in Northwell Health?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good, It was a fairly easy interview process. You fill out the application form and set up an interview based on mutual availability. I applied online. I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: One interview, manager was nice, did not meet with anyone higher, required references, was led around unit after interview to meet staff, hospital was small but unit was nice. Friendly staff

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Recruiters are very helpful. They keep in contact with you and are always available. They make the hiring process very easy. Everything is by email,  which makes it even easier
Interview Questions: How many days you were available to work.

title: Clinical Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Red flags! There were desperate and the manager that interviewed me quit only being there under a year. No one lasts there more then 10 months. They seem nice and positive about the job but once you start nothing like what was described. The more you talk to co workers the more you want to leave. These people are miserable and trapped. The interview and job description are so fake. The company lacks to tell you all the responsibility you will take on and all the traveling you will do unpaid. Also red flag was Not telling you you have to stay on your phone and the on-call ready to work all the time especially on your PTO/Vacation
Interview Questions:
what is your past experience?
why do you want this job?
why do you like research?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: process took about 2 weeks, all interviews were virtual. First interview with different managers and a second interview with the assistant manager of the specific floor. Everyone was very friendly
Interview Questions:
strengths and weaknesses
Difficult patient scenarios
Clinical scenarios

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: This was for a job opportunity at Lenox Hill. After an initial Zoom interview with one Physician Assistant, there was a round robin kind of interview process  with two other PAs and the hospital's Director of Stroke
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Very poor communication and follow up.  Phone interviews were set but the HR dept did not show up for the interviews.  I was told they are in transition but that doesn't completely explain how disorganized the hiring process is.
Interview Questions: Two different interviewers.  First interviewer screened for experience.  She was enthusiastic and forwarded me to the second step.   Second interviewer set a Sunday afternoon weekend phone interview with a log on code for a 15 slot.  I sat on the site at the allotted time waiting.  The Northwell HR interviewer never showed up nor responded to emails.  I received an email a week later with time slots for 15 minute interviews this time for weekdays in the evening from 7pm-11pm.  Very odd interview hours.  I was offered a position with a start date but there was no follow up.  The job never materialized.

title: Activities Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy but lengthy. I interviewed twice. Both time were with two people in the room and they mostly asked me about my background and threw some scenarios at me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced a difficult client and how did you handle it?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions:
I had a recruiter from Northwell actively reach out to me on LinkedIn, interested in my background for a role. The first time, I was quite delayed in my response and never heard from them but figured covid had impacted open roles, etc. Flash forward almost a year and the same recruiter reached out to me on LinkedIn again and asked me to send my resume to their email address. I did it quickly and was so excited to pursue a potential role at Northwell.

A week goes by, I haven't heard anything. So I check in to see if the email got to them.

The recruiter tells me "I contacted you twice but received no response or callback." 

So, without scheduling a call with me, the recruiter called me twice and did not leave a voicemail or send a follow-up email to let me know they tried to reach me. 

As a recruiter myself, I am constantly on the phone with candidates so I'm certainly not always able to answer calls, especially ones I am not expecting (it's also the age of robocalls, isn't it?).

I apologized for missing the call (even though, quite frankly, it is not even remotely my fault) and asked if I could still be considered for the role.

I got no response.

I followed up again just to clarify -- had I lost the opportunity to interview for the role? 

Almost a week has passed and I've received no response.

I have multiple friends who work at Northwell and said their own interview processes were painstaking efforts that were extremely stretched out.

I wish I could have been considered for the role, because I provide a really great candidate experience for all of the roles I hire for. But instead, I got some really weird and rude treatment from a recruiter. I'm bummed.
Interview Questions: Did not get to interview questions because the outreach from the recruiter was quite confusing and poorly done.

title: Intern Interview

I also think that it also prevented some people from being able to interview as they may not have access to a computer with a webcam and the ability to video themselves.
Interview Questions: What is a project that you have worked on and explain how you were successful?

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview

Interview Questions:

2. What do you know about Northwell?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: IT Systems Engineer Interview

Interview Questions: No interview actually took place: merger/aquisition.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2020

Interview Questions: What’s Your current position ? Why do you want to work with northwell

title: Intern Interview

title: Secretary Interview

Interview Descriptions:
When you apply, it takes about 2-3 weeks sometimes sooner if they need people. After someone will reach out to you via email to get a interview date, after that you will
be invited to the office to interview

title: Healthcare Management Program Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took time but went very smoothly! Many rounds of interviews. Entire process took over a month. Overall a great process.

title: Practice Billing Associate Interview

Drug test/physicals are scheduled. Start date is on the calendar for 3 weeks out.

title: Registered Nurse, MedSurg Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Valley Stream, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the nursing director to interview. I came in the next day met with 2 nurse managers, followed by a peer interview with 2 nurses from the floor.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself and your professional history. 
2. Tell me about a time you had a conflict and how did you resolve it. 
3. What is the biggest challenge of being a nurse?
4. What is your biggest strength?
5. What is your biggest weakness?
6. What would you do to prepare for a crisis and there was to be an influx of high acuity patients? 
7. How do you deal with stress? 
8. Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
9. Do you see yourself going back to school?
10. Why should we hire you over the other candidates that we interviewed? 
11. What quality do you possess that makes you a great nurse?
12. Do you have a flexible schedule? 
13. Are you a team player? 
14. Do you have any questions for us?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Valley Stream, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nurse director called me and set up an interview for the next day with 2 nurse managers from the med/Surg floors.  This was followed by a peer interview with 2 nurses from the floor.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself and your professional experience?
What is your biggest strength?
What is your biggest weakness?
What qualities do you possess that makes you a great nurse?
What would you do in a time of crisis and the hospital was told that there would be an influx of a lot of critical patients?
What do you find the most difficult part of being a nurse? 
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Do you see yourself going back to school?
Tell me about a time you dealt with a conflict, how did you resolve it?
Are you a team player?
How do you deal with stress?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straight forward and management does try to make you feel comfortable. They will ask you questions such as “tell me about yourself” “why this job”, “what do you see yourself doing in the future”, and strengths/weaknesses.
Interview Questions: Why Northwell? Strengths/weaknesses and talk about relevant experience

title: Patient and Customer Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very good and informative. It was a good process and had a lot of information. They were able to explain role with ease. The person was also very attentive and detail oriented.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself within the organization?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It took about a month after a recruiter reached out to me for a phone interview. I kept applying to open positions and she called me for a in-person interview with the nurse manager one month after.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the enter team, which was really pleasant. General behavioral questions + career interests and personality fit was a big emphasis as the team is small and works very closely with one another.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They brought me into a room and I was asked questions.  It was not intimidating at all.  Once I was offered the position, I had to have a physical and background check.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was extremely friendly and nice! They asked questions about my background. They seemed to be interested in getting to really know me. After the interview, you need to complete an excel case study which if you do not know excel like the back of your hand, it is rather difficult.
Interview Questions: What are some of your hobbies?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with Northwell Health a few years back and also recently for two different HR related positions.  A few years ago, I went in person for an interview and was told there was no position available at the interview.  This was after I took off of work just to come there and interview.  It left an incredibly bad impression.  Now, years later when I was called for a phone interview, I decided to give Northwell the benefit of the doubt because it had been years ago and because they had a great reputation.  I was wrong.  I was told on the phone that they wanted to bring me in to interview with the team as soon as possible.  The recruiter even got back to me and left me a voicemail shortly after our call that morning to schedule something.  I missed the call, but I did call back and leave a voicemail.  No call back.  I followed up with an email and a few days later I was told that they would bring me in if their current candidate didn’t work out as they were looking to fill the role quickly.  Wow!  What a way to leave a candidate feeling like they were a good choice for the position.  I knew then and there that this company was a mess.  It was a disappointment to say the least as Northwell has such a great reputation.  I will not be submitting my application for consideration again.  Time to improve the candidate experience.
Interview Questions: Why Northwell?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Took two months, easy, describe your strengths and weaknesses, why northwell. Had to have a physical exam done. The questions and conversations where easy, but the process did take a while. They do call your employer almost immediately.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this role.

title: Associate Executive Director Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Prescreen with contingency recruiting firm, phone interview with executive recruiter, in person interview with HR peer and dotted line potential boss.  In person interview was scheduled for an hour.  After about half an hour I noticed the peer looking at her watch a couple of times.   Pretty rude.  Neither interviewer really opened up about what they were looking for, nor did they seem that respectful that I had traveled quite a distance to be there.  In fact, I felt like they couldn't wait to get me out the door.  Very unprofessional.  Feedback after the interview was vague.  I got the impression I was a last minute add, and that they had already made up their minds to pass others on to the next stage.
Interview Questions: Take us through your resume and experience

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: interviewed once with team and then manager asked simple questions and then an accounting assessment on debit/credits and P&L statement which where strait forward overall easy process office was rather small
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: PRACTICE OFFICE ASSOCIATE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied to job months ago & got an email last week for virtual interview, i did it the same day then got an email to interview w the office manager the next day. I went to the interview and as soon as i sat the manager she said how one of the ladys in the office came and said how she liked me.  She asked me a few questions then told me about training , the hrs i would work and how i would do. She said she thinks i will be a great fit and will send my resume to hr. She basically just got to know me as a person and everything went great im hoping i got the position i called and she said i would find out by the end of the weeks. She said how i would do background check etc. i asked if I would need references she said no. She did interview over 10 people that day so im not sure
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Rehabilitation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy going and laid back. They asked simple interview questions and talked about your previous experiences to see if you make a good fit. The interview consisted of 2 people and both of them just wanted to really get to know you.
Interview Questions: How well do you do under pressure?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a 20 minutes Skype Interview  with a current fellow.  It started from an introduction of the candidate, followed by several standard questions such as "what makes you an unique candiate" , and finished with questions that the candidate would like to ask.
Interview Questions: what makes you an unique candidate

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had the chance to meet with 5 members of the HR team. I am only writing this post because they can do better with the candidate experience. If you take the time to come onsite and meet with 5 people, you shouldn’t have to wonder or guess where you stand. If it’s a no that’s fine but why does the candidate have to seek you out to get that information? Waiting 6 weeks is too long. I really wanted to work for this organization but I feel differently now. It’s very frustrating to feel like you are not treated with dignity and respect.  And it is equally disappointing when it was on your list as the top company that you wanted to work.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Northwell?

title: Front End Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and to the point.  Was able to learn a little about the Northwell Health operational system and was pleased to hear they provide some training for the software I will utilize in case I'm hired.

I interviewed with the superior Mount Sinai and NYU.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two interviewers. Bring multiple copies of your resume. Arrive early and be prepared with questions for them about the unit. Think about your answers and it’s relevancy to the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to be a nurse

title: HMP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first round is a prerecorded interview where you have as many tries to record as you like with around 5-6 questions. The second is a live video chat interview that is around 15 mins
Interview Questions: What is a time that you have used data analysis to solve a problem

title: Healthcare Management Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed by live panel interview consisting of 3-4 people. Heard back within 2 months of panel interview. Be ready to share how your experiences relate to the role and be educated on Northwell's history.
Interview Questions: Why Northwell?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: For the interview process, I was first contacted to discuss the position, see my interest level and then set up a time for either and in house interview or over the phone interview. The interviewer suggested the over the phone and that I what I chose.
Interview Questions: There were normal questions regarding your character, times of struggle or hardship and how you overcame that obstacle in your life. The following question was one that I remember and was interesting. What was the most ill patient you've seen and how did you provide care?

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview through a referral. Hiring manager contacted me 2 weeks later and offered me the position. The interviewer was very professional and courteous and asked me about my experience with the tasks that the position would require me to complete. I had peripheral knowledge in regards to the position and was up front about my lack of experience in other fields.
Interview Questions: What are your 3 strengths and weaknesses?

title: Prior Authorization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Great Neck, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was by phone, then I was given an assessment.  Since i passed the assessment they arranged an interview with 3 managers.  The interview was easy, managers made me feel at ease and comfortable and gave me a tour of the building and departments
Interview Questions: They me about yourself, your experience etc

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got a call back from HR recruiter and she asked me 3 easy questions. Scheduled a face to face interview the next day. Met with the nursing director and nurse manager. Both very nice and polite. Interview went for around 15 minutes very quick. They spoke about the unit and position. Said to hear back within a week. It has been 3 days and still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: How do you relieve stress?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially screened through HR on phone interview to discuss position and then interviewed in person at the facility. I got a tour of the hospital while discussing with 2 lead PAs.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have and why Northwell/location

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Took a month to hear back from the recruiter after applying online. It was very easy and quick to set up the interview at the offices in manhasset. The recruiter was very clear about what to bring but she gave me the wrong information about the job which was frustrating to deal with. The interviewer was very helpful and kind. He made it very comfortable for me and I was able to not be nervous. I had a great experience
Interview Questions: Why nursing? Why ambulatory care?

title: HRIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Northwell has discriminatory hiring practices that exclude and adversely impact Black candidates. specifically HR their offices are almost entirely white. I received a phone and 2 face to face interviews.
Interview Questions: Situational questions

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: initial interview with HR representative from a nursing student job fair, approximately 30 minutes. asked about my career goals, why i wanted to pursue nursing, what i learned from each of my previous work experiences then with unit manager who i was matched with based on my previous experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you resolved an issue

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very fast I applied and 3 days later I got a call. Met with the hiring manager and recruiter and got a call a day later saying I had to fill out some paperwork online and go in for clearance
Interview Questions: Why do you feel like you would be a good fit here

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed 8x with 5 people for the job asked the same questions over and over it was crazy to say the least  didn’t find out I got the job till the last min
Interview Questions: Why should we hire u

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Was scheduled for two 30 minute phone interviews after the VP reached out to me on LinkedIn. During those calls, I was asked to follow up with them by phone the next day. After I reached out twice, there was no response. It's disappointing that leadership at Northwell does not respect the time candidates commit to interviewing enough to decline someone with a quick phone call or email.
Interview Questions: Why Northwell? Who are your stakeholders?

title: Access Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 30 minutes. Met with two different managers. Both took down notes on my resume. The process took a while if you know Northwell is a bit hard even to get an interview. I've been applying for months, and they finally emailed me about a job interview. I'm still waiting for a, but the meeting went pretty well. Everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at two locations. At one location it took about a week after applying for them to get back to me. I had a phone screening interview, then an in person interview with the nurse manager and assistant nurse manager. The interview was very generic, and they seemed disinterested the whole time and just reading through set questions. I'm not sure whether that's because they had found their candidate and were just bored or if it was me, but it only took about 15 minutes. The questions were easy, but they never even explained anything about the unit or position until I asked them to. The recruiter had stated in his email to contact him once I had finished my interview. I did, a few different times over a month. No one ever contacted me back. The position was never filled. This has been my experience that they never contact you back if they don't want you, so you're left hanging forever.
Interview Questions: What kind of preventative measures can you name for patients at risk for falls?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after being referred by two employees at Northwell Health. After about a week and a half, a Talent Acquisition member reached out to me and talked to me about scheduling an interview. Unfortunately, that position was filled and she couldn't get me an interview but I called whenever I noticed another position was open and soon enough she was able to get me an interview with a nurse manager at Lenox Hill. I was nervous at first but after meeting the nurse manager and a fellow PCA, all of my nerves disappeared! They asked me a few questions and asked about my work history, then explained what I could expect from the position as well as the orientation process. The PCA walked me through a typical day as a PCA and even took her time showing me the floor! About a week later, I got a call about offering me the position. Overall, the process is smooth and straightforward!
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about your work history.

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Overall Interview went very well, and process went smooth. Sent a Thank you email and 6 weeks later I sent a Followup email didn't receive any feedback. I think a follow-up response would be helpful.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply here

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I have two interview rounds. Phone and face to face. Which went really well. All thanks to Aplomb as they made sure I perform well in my interview by giving me interviews practices.
Interview Questions: Question focused on SQL and testing analytical skills.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received invitation for interview that day or next day after employee referral. Met with the leadership team of multiple clinical disciplines to talk about me and my past experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online in mid-May for the Critical Care Fellowship. Two rounds of in-person interviews after online application and HR phone interview. I was asked to specify which ICU I was interested in over the phone, I chose the SICU at Lenox Hill. The Fellowship also offers positions in the MICU and CTICU at LIJ. 

First interview was with the manager, educator, and an RN on the unit. Lasted about 30 minutes with a tour of the unit itself. Second interview happened about two weeks later with the Director of Surgical Services. Lasted about 20 minutes. Everyone I spoke with was very helpful throughout the whole process! Received an offer over the phone the day after my second interview with a letter to follow in the mail.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the SICU?

title: Catering Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was lengthy. Took about 2 months to hear back from HR that I got the position. Interview was 1:1 and took a little less than an hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: The first step of the interview is recorded. Unlike other recorded interviews you have the option to re-record in case you mess up anything. However, the response rate of the company was slow and full of spam emails that would tell you to submit the interview, months after you already do.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwell Health?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for Northwell Health 1st week of April. 
First time the HR called back for phone interview at 2nd week of April and HR never got back to me ever again for that job position.
Last week of April, a different HR called again for a RN position. Completed phone interview and then HR told me that they would send my resume to the managers. First week of May, HR got back to me and scheduled an interview with assistant manager. Got the results back in the next 2-3 days and accepted the job offer.

Be patient, keep applying even if you just get a phone interview and keep your options open.
Interview Questions: Tell me which clinical rotation was the most meaningful to you during school?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Two nurse managers interviewed me. They were very friendly even though I was nervous. The manager noticed that I was nervous and reassured me that I was doing great. Just waiting to get an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was just like any other interview, first you do an on demand video, they ask three questions, introduce yourself, why nursing, and what kind of fellowship would you be interested in. Then a phone interview and lastly a face to face interview.
Interview Questions:
How did you handle a difficult client?
What do you do on your time? 
Introduce yourself.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Overall good experience, typical questions. Most of the 2nd interviews were with other staff/asst. managers, so they rely heavily on the opinion of others. They want to see if you'll fit into their unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why this unit?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Yonkers, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
-Contacted  HR representative through LinkedIn and had a phone conversation 2 weeks later (15 min) 
- Got a call back to set up an in person interview within a week
- interviewed with HR, Nurse manager 
- Got a call back within a day about job offer and an official letter a week later
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to schedule a phone interview with HR 2 days after applying online. HR was  very nice and only asked me 2 questions. He offered me to interview for a position that I did not apply for but I was open to anything. I was told the next step is interviewing with the nurse manager. I scheduled the in-person interview through the phone with HR and received an email to confirm the date and time.

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: applied online though referral, was invited to meet recruiter in person after two weeks which went very smoothly, and then step 2 was meeting with the director. Recruiter was really nice and wanted you to do well.
Interview Questions:
Mostly resume questions
Tell me about a time when you had to handle a certain situation.
how would you handle someone who wants to prey for sensitive information 
How good are you in excel ex pivot tables
what are your aspirations
what are your goals
where do you see yourself

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Mount Kisco, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was not too long not too quick, very friendly. First met with HR, then I met with 2 managers. They seemed very nice and honest, seems like a nice place to work!
Interview Questions: What is a challenge for me?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online around beginning of April. Got a call back from talent acquisition ending of May. Talent acquisition rep was so friendly and informative. She scheduled an interview for me with the unit manager 3 days after we spoke. I interviewed with 5 people from the unit. Manager, 2 nurse educators, PCT, and RN. It was nerve racking but the environment they created was calming. Got called for reference 2 days later and got an offer EXACTLY a week after I interviewed!!! That’s how quick it was.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Computer Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty standard, pretty reasonable. Personally I'd love to work with this applicant, and learn from them. I'm confident enough in myself to not be afraid that someone new and more experienced is going to come in and start making me look bad. I'd like to use this as an opportunity to grow, and I don't think that being afraid of competition or of new people like this is rational or beneficial.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past tasks and achievements

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: it was very brief and quick, we talked about my experience in the hospital and what i could bring to the table. The overall process was easy and I got called back within 2 weeks
Interview Questions: how well do i multitask

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took a total of 6 weeks from the time I applied online till the time I interview. I interview for a analyst position. The interview was very easy. The interviewer talked about my past experience and how I can help their department grow. There was only one interview. I interview on Thursday and was given an offer on Tuesday. It was faster than I expected.
Interview Questions: What does CBC stand for?

title: Health Care Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a very quick turn around. The company used all demand interviews (the ones where you go and record answers online) before the final round of interviews. The final round consisted of one person from HR and two people that are current associates that had been interns. They threw us a curve ball question that unless you are very familiar with the industry, you would not know how to answer as well as behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in participating in the program

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: two interviews back to back with the patient care director and clinical nurse manager. phone interview with human resource  over the phone. Overall not a long process and HR was informative on how to prepare for interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Apr 2018
