title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was able to give my resume to a nurse manager on the unit. After, I had an interview with the nurse manager and the nurse educator. The asked pretty basic questions and after three days they offered me the job
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Well-organized process. First spoke with talent aquistion on a brief phone interview. Then in person, I met with HR and management on the same day. Which was then followed by a tour of the unit I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why do you want to work here?

title: PRACTICE OFFICE ASSOCIATE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR to schedule an appointment with a department on last week Thursday. The interview was quick and to the point. It wasn't nerve wrecking as we all think interviews would be. I was not nervous going into the interview and had a very pleasant encounter with the hiring manager. She really liked what was on my resume as well.
Interview Questions: I was asked what is the reason for me leaving my current job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had an in-person interview with 4 managers from the hospital, felt really comfortable. It became more of a conversation and why I was best fit for the job. At the end, they informed me of the position, orientation and asked if I had any other obligations that would prevent me from working there. They also stated they were looking for a 2-year commitment. Still waiting to hear back, it has been a week today!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Long Island City, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed over the course of a day and was able to speak with both hiring managers and current research associates. Pretty smooth process but I did have to travel there in person which was kind of a pain especially since I was not given an offer.
Interview Questions: What are your long term plans?

title: SICU Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was welcoming and well organized. HR was very knowledgeable and supportive.   They were proactive in pushing forward my application and accommodating to my scheduling needs. I was accepted to another job during the application process and they tried to match the other offer. All staff I've interacted with have been supportive and encouraging.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview with HR where they asked basic questions such as clinical scenarios, why telemetry , etc. Afterwards, HR stated the nursing manager from the unit would give me a call within the week to schedule a in person meeting. I didn't get a call back until 2 weeks later, but scheduled a interview the week of, and got offered the day of ! I met with the nurse manager and assistant manager.
Interview Questions: What qualities would you attribute to this hospital?

title: Senior Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Cheerful but very serious. The will give you every opportunity to convey who you are. Be very honest. They hold very dear to integrity. Be confident and have solid grades on your school's transcript.
Interview Questions: What was the best thing that I would get from this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Lack of attention to candidate for some nurse managers, almost disjointed .  Seems they only want experienced nurses,not willing to train.  States they promote veterans but not true.  I was not impressed with the management, nor some experience of the nurse managers. Staff support  seemed very minimal.  Almost as if they want you to hit the ground running.  Not bitter, just my assessment.  Interviewed at both South-Side and North Shore.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself...Why Northwell...Stressful encounter at work, how you handled it.

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It all depends on location and who your boss is. It can make or break your experience. Night shift is so much better no bosses but alot of work but you do what you can
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions nothing special

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR recruiter for Surgery - new grad position. Interviewer asked specific questions about my resume, gave lots of information about position, left with concrete next steps. Good conversation. Left lots of room for questions, so make sure you have some to ask. FYI - not sure about all of Northwell, but LIJ is a non union hospital.
Interview Questions: Asked about my clinical experiences in nursing school.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was nice and asked questions. Did not feel uncomfortable at all, and I got to meet everyone (management) all at once.  Initially nerve wrecking, but its nice to know everyone's role and get an idea of who you will be reporting to.  Looking forward to a bright future with Northwell.
Interview Questions: I believed they asked the same questions they would ask you on any interview. The people however made it so comfortable that you could just be yourself.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful experience we connected right away we talked about previous jobs I've done and how would i contribute to northwell health and what got me interested in this job.
Interview Questions: How well do i work with people

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Huntington, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a call from the recruiter. She was very polite n straight foward, got scheduled for interview the following two days which was Friday. Went through 2 stages of interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a furious customer

title: Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Nassau, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Extensive , long, tremendous amount of paperwork , very helpful and courteous on boarding and recruiting department made all of this very easy , most was fine online and via email. They answered every email and phone message quickly and with the appropriate answers to my questions
Interview Questions: Why did I want to switch to Northwell

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very easy and within a comfortable environment with various subspecialty members.  the interview itself was based off of a behavioral interview concept and if the environment and the people are the right fit for them and you... it turns into a conversation.
Interview Questions: when have you gone above and beyond for a patient

title: Critical Care RN Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was given a panel interview a week or so later. Panel Interviewers were very friendly and made the interview a comfortable process. This was my first interview as an RN, so although I didn't receive an offer, it was a acceptable start to the good few interviews I'd find myself going on after this one.
Interview Questions: Strengths? Weaknesses? A time you dealt with conflict and how? How do you deal with criticism from authority, whether it be constructive or not? Content questions about Critical Care.

title: Cytotechnologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I went on a full day interview and I met with 7 people in three different interviews. There was a slide test of 10 GYN and 10 NON-GYN. The first interview was one-on-one and the hardest. The last two were straight-forward.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email shortly after to set up an in-person interview. The person I met with noticeably wasn't prepared and clearly hadn't even looked at my resume before meeting. The questions during the interview weren't very in-depth and could have easily been done in a phone screening instead.
Interview Questions: What should I know about you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: So I only got through one step so far which was the phone interview. I want to share this information because when I was looking for it I couldn't find it. After the phone interview he said he would be in touch with me in about a week or so. So no offer yet.
Interview Questions: Describe what your head to toe assessment would look like.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a talent acquisition rep through Northwell who saw my online application. I had preliminary phone interview with rep that same week where he gave positive feedback. After about 2 wks of back and forth, he secured me an interview for that following week. Interview took place with manager and assistant manager to the floor. They explained the position and then proceeded with the interview. It took about another two weeks to be offered a position, but talent acquisition followed up with me weekly and contacted me right after interview as well.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself?

title: Nursing Attendant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and in about a week i got a call back. The interview itself was highly unsual. The director wasnt even aware of the position, asked VERY basic questions my phone interview was more in depth. The interviewer seemed slightly agitated and uniterested in interviewing me. I felt discouraged but still managed to get along with it despite their attitude towards me. Havent heard anything back as of yet but I will say this if you don't hear back within a week dont hold your breath, accept you may not have been chosen and continue your job search. Its not easy these days but dont give up!
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 phone interviews in the last couple of months with them. Both talent acquisition reps said they will follow up the week after and they never did, neither did they reply to my emails.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: DIrector, Community Health Education and Outreach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Mount Kisco, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Once I applied, it was about a month before I received a call.  HR-for the most part-are very young and a bit socially awkward in terms of  being able to connect with candidates.  There was a pre-screen onsite interview with an HR person who essentially asked me if my resume was accurate, followed by the actual interview.  The hiring manager was lovely but does not possess the professional clinical training to be interviewing for the role, nor supervising it.   It was interesting that a big emphasis is placed on the fact that they are Planetree certified despite the fact that it's not a benefit to the potential employee, and in this case, had absolutely nothing to do with the position I was interviewing for.   I got the feeling that the people telling me about their Planetree status didn't really understand what it was, but knew that the CEO was proud of it and wanted it out there for good PR.  I waited a month and when I still heard nothing, reached out to HR and received a reply that they had found another candidate to be better suited for the position.  Yet, the job is still posted.
Interview Questions: How would you reach out to the community?

title: Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Oct 2017

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was very straightforward. I interviewed with my direct supervisor. We discussed my background, her background, the department and its responsibilities, etc. It was conversational and I was also allowed the opportunity to ask questions about the title's responsibilities and for actual tasks and assignments I would the position is responsible for. Our conversation lasted about 25 minutes and then we concluded. I was told that there would be a notified if I would be invited to the second round. 

The second interview was with my direct supervisor and the VP of the department. It was a much shorter interview, but still conversational. We revisited some of the topics that were discussed in the first round interview, it seemed more like a formality and to make sure that I would be a good fit for the two of them.

Once the interview process is over, a physical is required where a drug test and vaccinations will be performed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current role and your ability to negotiate transactions within that role.

Had 3 interviews - 2 at the New Hyde Park location and 1 at the Upper East Side location (though this was due to the fact I was passed for the position I initialed applied for and was passed to another team in need of a support associate). Overall, these interviews were quite easy and causal, mostly just there for the current employees to get a vibe from me to see if I would fit with them. Only "task" required was a review of an acknowledgment letter during my first interview to demonstrating my editing abilities (spelling, grammar, syntax, etc.)

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. A month later I received an email from someone in HR who gave me more information about the position and the hospital and asked me to do a video interview. The video interview consisted of an intro, and 5 questions. The questions weren't difficult but they were behavioral/situation based and required thought before answering them. Once I clicked on the video I was given 3 hours to record myself answering the questions and then I had to submit it before the time was up. I then was asked to come in for a face to face interview two days after submitting the video. Face to face interview consisted of meeting separately with 4 different people who work in the finance dept. and the people that I interviewed were throwing a lot of information about medical terms and info about their complicated computer system. Once I moved on to speak with a different person it was almost like they were quizzing me to see what I retained from speaking with the person before me. Strange.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest accomplishment in life?

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Staten Island, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call about 2 weeks after applying. I had to take a typing test prior to the interview. I was then called to schedule a date and time.
Interview Questions: What drew me to apply to Northwell. My goals in life, etc.

title: Assistant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Glen Oaks, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview with manager and then interview with director. After both spoke had to wait another week to hear from them with a decision.  Had to wait awhile for HR to get everything cleared which took more than a month.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into this field?

title: Practice Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a recruiter. Than a in person interview with chief MD of the division, and administrative manager. Want to know how you will handle working with difficult employees, patient care issues, experience etc. Always want to know your strengths, weaknesses and how you work as a team.
Interview Questions: How would you do managing a senior union employee who is much older and much more experienced than you?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Sleepy Hollow, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: firstly meeting with HR. HR introduced salary and benefits to me. and then ask me couple of basic interview questions. after finishing HR section, she introduced me to director. in round 2 with director, the interview is more like regular conversation, but she can tell if you fit this position or not.
Interview Questions:
how you deal with the incident when patient feel angry
why social work

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with emergency room management  for a one on one interview. After interview waited 2-3 day received a call being accepted for the position. Had to go through through pre employment screenings and document submissions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in an Hospital

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Took 1 month after resume submission to get an interview.
Phone interview, then arranged 1:1 face to face.
HR doesn't know campus you have interview, so no real direction given.
People had interview with just assumed you would find them and did not arrange to meet you in the lobby.
HR never lets you know status after interview complete.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Director and one of the managers in the business operations department.  The interview was more conversational, they told me about the position and what to expect.  I asked a few questions and roughly 30 minutes later they asked if i was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: FlexStaff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Great Neck, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview was great, very detail and oriented. a lot of information to gather but all you have to do is bring all your personal information then you would be fine. the process went well, a lot of locations to choose from.
Interview Questions: the location that I would prefer to work in.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was called to by HR and asked a few interview questions. Then we set up an interview to meet with a nurse manager. The nurse manager asked about 3-4 situational questions (what would you do). After 2 weeks, I was contacted by HR and offer a RN position.
Interview Questions: What is pain management? How do you decipher if a patient is in pain? How would you handle a coworker dispute on the floor?

title: Clinical Dietitian PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got a phone call next day from HR and scheduled an interview with Hiring Manager same week. I wasn't ask any technical or behavioral questions, spent most time discussing company and job requirements in general.
Interview Questions: Ask about my previous job and talked about company and job.

title: Copywriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview on the spot. Asked basic questions and if you knew about the company, including the company's history. Wants to know if you have any ties with the company. Was told I was going to get a second interview in a week or two and never received any additional follow up calls, emails etc.
Interview Questions: What strategies are you currently using to create a better brand for a company?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Poor communication. I had to follow up multiple times even after I was told I had the position. The recruiter and the department head did not seem to be communicating and were not on the same page. Ultimately I accepted the position but there was a decent amount of anxiety trying to get answers regarding hire date, etc.
Interview Questions: "What's your story?"

title: Administrative Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: HR rep calls asks you some questions, basically a mini phone interview and then sets up an interview with the hiring manager.  Hiring manager didnt really ask any questions basically outline the position and asked only two or three questions.
Interview Questions: have you ever had to deal with a frustrated client and how did you handle that

title: Nurse Externship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: my interviewer showed up late to the interview, called me by the wrong name, and walked out of the room while I was mid-sentence. needless to say I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to be a nurse?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed with two other girls, but some people interview individually. We were kindly asked questions about volunteering and the hospital setting in general. There was also a follow up orientation.
Interview Questions: What are some leadership roles you have in life?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR. Was a phone interview. Interviewer told me he would send resume to the manager. No follow up from manager. Someone else got the job but I did not like how I had to keep looking on the website to figure that out.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your preceptorship. Tell me about your previous job. Why did you decide to become a RN. Why are you interested in this position?

title: Procurement Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick and easy. First round consisted of a group/panel interview with 3 managers/ AVPs. Second interview was with the Chief Procurement Officer. No real technical questions were asked. Basically all personality questions. Had two rounds of interviews. Simple excel test was given.
Interview Questions: Do you have a passion for healthcare?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by both directors of the kitchen.  I was also given a tour of the kitchen which i was told was a good sign. I was informed of what a typical day would be like.  I was informed of the hours i would be working.
Interview Questions: What was my prior experiencd with food service.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy talking to the recruiter; was contacted a week after applying; very nice people; they directed me to the right places; just practice for the interview; very basic questions
Interview Questions:
Very basic questions.
What is strength and weakness?

title: Payroll Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took around 3 plus months. Met with 4 - 5 managers/Directors. They ask typical questions regarding your qualifications and why you're interested in the position. There was a lack of communication in terms of what was happening throughout the 3 month period.
Interview Questions: How well versed are you in PeopleSoft?

title: PRACTICE OFFICE ASSOCIATE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Woodbury, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Typical standard interview questions. Nothing really medical or technical other than what experience you have in medical field. They look at your experience and emphasized the schedule and timeliness. It is good if you plan to be in the medical field as your career path.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in a medical office before?

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Bay Shore, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online and received a phone call to interview with department manager. The interviewing manager is no longer with the department. They asked strengths and weaknesses and very general questions. they inquired as to my previous responsibilities with my most recent job and my availability. Offered job upon leaving.
Interview Questions: Reason for leaving previous employee.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line, they got back to me after few days,I had a short talk with HR and then they scheduled an interview with the nurse manager. I had an hour interview with the nurse manager on the floor. She explained about the position, gave me a little tour and then the interview started
Interview Questions:
- strengths/weakness
- difficult patient and how I react
a lot of behavioral questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I was suppose to be interviewed by a Nurse manager however last minute she decided to invite another Nurse whose position I do not remember. The nurse manager was very nice and informative about the Hospital, the other just observed. They both asked questions and I felt double the pressure.
Interview Questions: Several NCLEX style questions, Most complicated patient and their treatment, explain and give example of leadership skills you possess....

title: ER Volunteer/Shadow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very calm and relaxed. It did not take long for me to get called in for the interview since there was also another person getting interviewed at the time I went. The questions were very basic and the process was very organized. The interview was short and thorough and I was told to start whenever I'd like.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer?

title: Administrative Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Was called 4 days after applying. Interviewed with the regional manager.  It went very well, so much so, she had me meet immediately with the Units Medical Lead. One week later had an interview with the Regional Director. Then days later received a call with a Job offer. Needed to take a Physical and supply my references email, title and phone numbers.
Interview Questions: Are you a leader or a follower?

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The accounting manager asked non-standard interview questions. The interview includes an excel accounting test which was quite simple.Requires some familiarity with medical practice accounting. I was only interviewed by 2 people because the 3rd person was unavailable when the first 2 interviews were completed. FrThe office is small but the staff seemed friendly
Interview Questions:
Am I a leader or a follower?
What is the thin that drives me the most?
If I could go back in time what would career decisions would I make differently

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Bay Shore, NY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process itself was very simple and painless. I met with the Research Coordinator as well as the Primary Investigator of the study and they were both wonderful! I felt at ease during our conversation and appreciated the thorough and frequent communication via emails during the process (status updates, etc). The hiring process, however, was absurd (through no fault of those I met with). I was interviewed in December, offered the position in January, and then told that I must go through the various Northwell Health protocol before I can begin (medical exam, background check, orientation/training, etc). I did all of these things immediately, yet they took TWO MONTHS to actually process any of it! I was not able to begin working at this position until March.
Interview Questions: What inspired you to work in this field?

title: Rehabilitation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was relaxed. Asked about experiences and why I would want to be a part of the health system. There were two rounds of interviews, both were on a one to one basis.
Interview Questions: Customer or patient experiences. A time dealing with a difficult patient.

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from the recruiter and she told me to come in with required documents. I arrived at the interview site about 45 minutes early, because i didn't know exactly where i was going. Dressed in interview attire when i arrived,  i had to fill out a questionnaire and wait until the recruiter called my name. She interviewed me. The interview went well. I Received a phone call some days later about taking a drug screening test, and a physical. When i came back they had me and other candidates who were also offered jobs to sit in a room and take a reading, and writing test. Once that was done, the next week i had to go for orientation, and i received my work schedule.
Interview Questions: what can I bring to the company?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Melville, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to lij for a customer service position in August 2015. I received an email in Sept to call to set up a phone interview with a recruiter. The phone interview was simple she asked why I wanted to leave my current position and told me more about the position I applied for, hours, benefits, salary. She told me that someone would be in touch with me to set up an interview. In Nov 2015, 2 months later, I received an email with an interview time and location, they didnt give me an option on which day to pick. I got to the interview 15 mina early, it was at a call center, they were interviewing all day. I checked in with the receptionist which was extremely nice. My first interview was with a department manager, it was more like a conversation not like an interview, we just discussed my experience, but i was told by the recruiter this was a full time position and I get there and its per diem position, i continued with the second interview with the main manager and he was very apologetic that he wished the recruiter would have told everyone the position was per diem especially to the people that currently have jobs. It was a good interview but i wish i didnt take off work for it
Interview Questions: If I hit the lotto what is the first thing Im doing

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was first screened through the website. The website asked for a resume, and I was contacted within a month. The actual interview itself was done at their main office, which has free parking which is nice. I sat for about an hour before being interviewed, which only took 5 minutes.
Interview Questions: Do I have a current license.

title: Vice Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with the chairman several times, and he was honest, forthright, and clear in communications. He was a consummate professional. We talked on the phone and had an interview one on one.
Interview Questions: What is your vision for radiology in the next 5 years or so? How will you build a research program? What problems have you encountered in prior jobs with personnel and how did you resolve them?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Felt very comfortable and at ease during the interview. Questions were pertinent to the field and based off my resume as well. It was easy to locate the office and met with the program director after a phone interview.
Interview Questions: What qualities do I have that would help me succeed in a stressful and busy environment?

title: Secretary II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Valley Stream, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview with HR then meet with dept manager. Answered a lot of questions about my skills. Then we went over my positions details. I was given a tour of the department and asked when I would be available to start if I was hired. I followed up on another computer input of my information and was told that I would hear from them when a decision was made.
Interview Questions: What made you want to work in a hospital?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional interview. It was a few minutes long and when i was hired i was told i was chosen because they like how i looked the first time they saw me.
Interview Questions: What are your computer skills? Can you use outlook and excel?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with about five medical professionals and supervisors, multiple case scenarios (about 5 or 6), interpreting labs (3 or 4), diagnosing, assessing, plan/treatment, follow-up, how to deal with difficult families. Interview lasted about one hour.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose this hospital?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The Nurse Manager, Clinical Educator, and another RN on the floor interviewed me. They asked me the typical questions.. why Lenox Hill, why did you want to be a nurse, asked about some of my past experiences (I was a new grad). They then toured me around the floor. One week later I received an offer from HR. I was very turned off as they mentioned they are still doing paper charting for assessments, it seemed very backwards to me and as if the hospital isn't a progressive one.
Pay is roughly 81k for nights, every other weekend, new grad, BSN
Interview Questions: Why not one of the other hospitals in NSLIJ system on Long Island?

title: Service Excellence Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer seemed initially interested in my current position and how well I knew my current bosses name-dropping a few... She had a list of questions specific to my resume where she wanted me to elaborate on certain things. Followed that by ask some general information on my personal goals. I must have said something wrong along the way because she ended the interview by saying it was only "exploratory" and the position was not approved in the budget and I probably wouldn't be hearing from her for 100 years since she's so busy, but feel free to email her (I did and no response). Of the 60+ positions I applied for this was the only one I was called for an interview and it supposedly not even a real position. Unfair waste of time.
Interview Questions: What would you say is the current nature of the healthcare climate as it relates to the patient experience

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview with LIJ was one of the more extensive interviews I've had. They asked me normal interview questions..like asked me to introduce myself, go through my resume, and then presented me with clinical scenarios and asked me how I would approach these different situations. They asked me about to give them an example of a time when I found myself in a conflict with a nurse and I went about to resolving the issue.
Interview Questions: A doctor put in an order for IV Tylenol. The hospital has a strict policy on this and has restricted its use to certain patients. The doctor is giving you a difficult time and insists his patient needs this medication. What would you do?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Short interview that involved asking your career goals and where you would like to be placed. It was very relaxed and is mostly a means to learn about your character.
Interview Questions: What will you get out of volunteering here?

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forwards
Walk through resume
Make sure you review how to enter journal entries and p&l statements 
There is a skills excel exam it's timed 30mins
There's an intial phone screen then there's an in person interview on site.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have been applying with lij online since last year i always check every other day on my phone for any openings i finally got my first interview with forest hills hospital for pca. Then on the same day i got a call from a hiring recruiter for an interview at lenox hill hospital for nursing assistant  I was hired on the spot was so surprise.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your job.

title: Back Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Started as a temp and had the opportunity to show my abilities, so the interview process was easier. Interview process for the temp position was however grueling. Several online and classroom training and testing sessions and an extensive screening process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Access Representatives Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Everything went smoothly . They were very nice people. Found out about the job through a hiring agency. In the end the position was offered to me. It was an easy hiring event if you have the experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths ?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an employee & was told by my referral to apply online. I applied & got a call from a nurse recruiter a week later. She talked to me briefly & asked me a few questions. She then invited me in for an interview 2 days later to meet with the director of the department. The director was very laid back, she asked a few questions, but very basic about my current position & my past experiences. The interview ran for about 40 minutes or so. I thought it went very well.  Toward the end of the interview, she told me to get in touch with the recruiter to send my references. I sent my references on Monday & was told mid-week that I'd be contacted as soon as my references came back, but have yet to hear back. This was almost 3 weeks ago!
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current position

title: RN Med Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The Nurse Manager and one of the Charge Nurses conducted a professional and friendly interview.  I was extremely impressed with the hospital, the unit, the friendliness of the staff and the interviewers.  There were quite a number of RNs being interviewed for the same position.  The interview was only 10 to15 minutes in length.
Interview Questions:
Various clinical questions... What would you do if...?
Why would you want a job here?
Tell me about yourself
Tell me about a situation where a patient was unhappy.  How did you handle it?

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talent acquisition contacts you for a pre-interview, if they like you during the phone interview section they ask you to come and interview in person. They were really flexible with the interview time, they met me around 4:30 a week later.
Interview Questions: Where do you see you

title: Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First on-site interview with the AVP. He's the worst employer to work for - a micro-manager and difficult to work with. 
The interview was ok - behavioral questions were the major chunk of the interview (they're not going to offer lunch so be prepared to starve an entire half day)
Second on-site interview with all the senior members of the team in Long Island. (Again half-day)
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years
Name the top 3 problems healthcare is facing today
Why should we hire you

title: Telemetry Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: sit down and meet with a nurse who asks the standard interview questions - what are your best/worst traits etc, why North Shore LIJ, what do you look for in a job
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a job?

title: Temp Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly quick. I took a typing test to pass the 30 wpm criteria. Then I met with a recruiter to discuss my customer service skills. They explained the position would have no benefits, raises, OT etc but that if I performed my job well I could be hired and receive benefits. I did their training classes which were spread across the course of 1 month and finally started working at the end of July.
Interview Questions: Would you quit your current job to work here full time knowing you won't get benefits?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, first interview was with talent acquisition questions based on resume. Second interview questions were behavioral questions, got a call after 2 months after my second interview  then I got an offer. Manager was nice enough to give a tour of the or and answered  all my questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The department sought me out, so the interview process was very smooth. I had an interview with the manager I would be working directly with, then another follow-up with the SVP of the department. The on-boarding process took a few weeks, but all in all, a great interview experience.
Interview Questions: Why would I like to join this department.

title: Critical Care Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions:
It was a great experience overall. The atmosphere was formal but slightly conversational. The only disappointing aspect concerning the entire process is not receiving any responses regarding the next step. Even though I won't give up, it is soul crushing not to hear anything back from one of your top institutions that you hope to build your career with. 

My humble feedback to the recruiting team would be to give a quicker response to potential candidates if they haven't been selected for the position that they interviewed for and to keep the channel of communication open if there are other positions that candidates might be better suited for.
Interview Questions: Why did you go into nursing?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Albany, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Several steps of discussions with various stakeholders; all positive interactions. First, there were several phone screens.  Then I went to Albany for a day of interviews.  Lastly, I had a final interview with one of the senior partners.
Interview Questions: Situational interview questions - please explain a time when you encountered pushback, etc. and how you addressed it. Another format - how would you handle this situation (insert scenario)?

title: Flex Staff Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewer was calm and made me feel comfortable. 
The first thing I did was the typing test on the computer. 
Then the interviewer got the score and lead me to the interview room. 
The interviewer explained the whole process and informed me that it takes about one month to go through the background check (you get an e-mail/phone call from them indicating when to come in for fingerprinting & also drop off your documentation, i.e ID, etc - both the sec team & doc lady were very nice & welcoming), online training (not paid and VERY long- it takes days - and you are tested after almost each of the approx. 20 modules ), two classroom trainings (both are about 8 hours in total - paid). 
I was also informed that as a flex staff employee, I would normally be covering for their current employees who are taking leaves of absence and they cannot guarantee that it would lead to a permanent position. 
Also there are no benefits for flex staff employees. 
Again after all is done, you have to go to NS-LIJ where they take you to their computer room to get your NS-LIJ ID-badge and set-up your direct deposit/tax withholding/ for payment purposes.  
You also get your user ID & password for computer access once working onsite.
Interview Questions: Why I applied for the position, my previous experience, my skills, etc...

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant interview and I was made to be comfortable and the interviewer was very nice I was asked how do I register new patients that come into Radiology and once I explained the process I was then informed on how their process was at the Manhasset location.
Interview Questions: What programs do I use to register.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The Recruiters are very friendly and ask you the standard - why you want to be a nurse, why you want to work here questions, and also they ask a few clinical scenarios (a what would you do in this situation type of question).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Hospital Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: One round of Skype interview was conducted following their processing of the mailed-in applications, which included one letter of recommendation in addition to a cover letter, resume, and transcript. Two interviewees conducted the interview - a project manager/former intern, and the director of volunteer work from Northshore University Hospital. The questions were standard behavioral interview questions - no case component and nothing unexpected.
Interview Questions: What was one time you overcame a challenge?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant and comfortable interview process. I was greeted in the lobby upon arrival and had a casual interview process with all of the staff within my own department.
Interview Questions: What was your senior thesis about?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Full day, met with 5 people. The day was scheduled out for one hour sessions, back to back,  and was intense questioning regarding your profession. I asked many questions of the interviewer's which shows you did your homework. People were very professional, and extremely busy.
Interview Questions: They focus in on PMO processes and how familiar you are with the 9 knowledge areas of PMBOK as a good organization should. Depending on the area of assignment, you will receive question of a technical nature to show what you know about the technology. Expect to be able to white board a specific process out to show how you would approach a problem or project life cycle.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Meet the team for 30 minutes each without any real structure. Kind of like repeating the interview with each person. You kind of meet whoever is available. Sometimes the interviewer would just babble and keep talking and others will let you talk the whole time. Mostly a test for fit and your personality.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions: tell me about yourself. Brain teaser questions. NPV question.

title: Lead Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: very descriptive and to the point , no messing around. went in asked me a few questions on my emplacement and skills they seemed impressed. I was given a phonecall a couple weeks later on whether not i wanted the job, i declined for a better offer.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in this company

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
13 months met with 6 people
a lot of scenarios then the abyss then a call back then more silence, then a call back, greatest strength, greatest weakness examples of success.
Interview Questions: typical questions out of a 1983 HR book,  greatest strength, greatest weakness examples of success. how did you deal with a sticky situation, how do you deal with irate clients

title: Testing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recommended by the person who was leaving the position. Face to face interviews with several leads on the same day in more than one location. Final interview was a phone interview with someone I hadn't met and seemed quite confused as to which position I was applying for.  Interestingly it also seemed that he had the position I had applied for and was interviewing me for something else. The process ended abruptly when I received an email from HR telling me my candidacy was no longer valid. Several email and phone calls to HR and the interviewers did not illicit a response.
Interview Questions: Tell me about process? I asked for clarification to determine what the interviewer was asking for. He didn't seem to know and continues to ask 'Tell me about process". Then he abruptly ended the conversation saying he would have someone from the team call me.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I have been interviewed three times on different occasions for three different jobs. Not hired yet. Takes a long time for them to get back to you and they know it. Lots of people apply online so not much can be done about that.
Interview Questions: Demanding questions, unrealistic expectations.

title: Clinical Laboratory Technolgoist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a call within a week and setup an interview. HR was very helpful with the time and the date. Interviewed with a supervisor, coworkers, and directors. Had skills test for pipetting technique.
Interview Questions: Interview itself went pretty well. Asked about the future goal and my weakness and strongest side of personality.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the careers website, was contacted by Human Resources about 2 weeks later to set up a phone interview. Phone interview was very basic, nothing too difficult. She asked to talk about my rotations. Two weeks later was called in to come into the hospital to meet with the PA supervisor of the department. She asked about my past experiences, what I learned from them, rotations, and some specific patient experiences.
Interview Questions: Described a patient situation that required who to do a lot medically.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: For what I have heard from new upcoming medical assistants, the interview process has shorten in length. When I first applied 5 years ago, it took about 2 months from when i was first contacted by HR to my first day on the job. Currently it takes about a month.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult questions

title: Temporary Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from flex staff , sent me a wpm test , interview in new Hyde park , interviewer was part of talent acquisition, very stern, everything was clear cut nothing was negotiable at all ..I declined job offer there was no advantages for me other than "this is your foot in the door" and when I left he told me if I knew any other person with medical experience such as myself let him know. How unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Are you 100% sure you want this job?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an active employee and the interview process was very easy. Human resources only asked me 3 questions.  The entire interview only lasted tops 20 minutes.  Within 3 days I had a job offer. But credentialing took some time. In total I'd say about 50 days from start to finish. One piece of advise stay on top of your paperwork.  Medical staff is good but I can see things taking longer than it should if you are not proactive. Consider dropping your paper work off in person and avoid faxing. I never got emails back saying they received my materials sent. I always had to email them constantly.  Otherwise very professional and it seems like they have the process stream lined.
Interview Questions: Tell be about a situation you encountered a patient who was difficult to treat? and Tell me what made it challenging?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The entire process from start to finish was extremely lengthy. I would go weeks without hearing anything back about the next step. Declined other offers while waiting to hear back. Phone calls were not returned.
Interview Questions: Best quality

title: Programmer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and open. Questions were standard interview questions, pass experience, strong suites, weak suites etc.. I received and accepted an offer. I'm currently employed with this company. The over all interview experience was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Why I decided to leave my previous employer

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Long Island City, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple, apply online wait for a recruiter to call, interview with them over phone, set up management interview, very clean cut easy process. Overall very simple and helpful staff, makes interviewing and getting a ob offer a breeze
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwell Health

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Recently Interview with LIJ, new grad it seems that you have to know someone to get an interview however I got it on my own with lots of leg work... Waiting to hear back
Interview Questions: Questions are mostly about what you would do in a situation.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and lengthy. I met with multiple people throughout the process. Lots of the same questions were asked that were repetitive.  They have you meet with the whole group just to make sure that people like you.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter then in-person interview with unit manager... Easy questions. Unit hires new graduates. I got an email to inform me that I got the position as long as my references checked out and passed drug test
Interview Questions: How will you get to work?

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Multi-tiered interview process including peer interviews.
Met with director via phone interview initially and then 1:1. 
That was followed by peer interview.
Offer was made by talent recruiter.
I accepted offer and began working within 2 weeks of employment proposal.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an irate end user?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Port Washington, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point. Professional Human Resources interviewer very nice. no wait on the interview date. on time. pleasant. Nice even after suggesting I was not suitable for the role.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work with the organization

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Talent acquisition is inconsistent and requires a lot of follow up to get any answers. I missed the chance to interview for a position because they didn't contact me with the outcome of a previous interview after a couple of weeks. Actual interview was very positive.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Maintenance Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Glen Cove, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward in that I was told to fill out an application and references documentation. I met with the facilities maintenance manager of the school and one of his associates. That part of the interview went very well that thing you answered questions before I ask them. Most questions revolved around skills and abilities to follow through with various tasks that have to do with the daily activities of the school. I was brought before the facility managers boss and that aspect also went very well which led me to believe that they were rather desperate to fill the position.
Interview Questions: Can you patch a hole in plaster or replace a faucet or toilet? How do you feel about getting called to fix a paper jam?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I simply sit down conversation with Dr. Szeszko. Very casual. I think he just wanted to make sure I wasn't a total dunce. Very nice guy.  We had a conversation about his research and what I wanted to get out of it.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the brain?

title: Unit Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, typing test and then face to face interview. Manager was very friendly.  Just be confident in yourself. The typing test consisted of typing and data entry, you could take the test numerous of times to get a better score
Interview Questions:
What’s your strengths and weaknesses?
Tell me about your previous experiences?

title: Unit Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: One interview with nursing manager.  She asked simple and direct questions to me. Referred by a current employee so my resume was chosen for an interview.  Process took a while to hear back.
Interview Questions: What is your time management like?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was held in a series of interviews with different managers from different teams to see which team you would best fill. Based on experience and personality you are put in a team that would best suit you.
Interview Questions: Why Northwell Health?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have an interview. It was more like the HR recruiter calling me and telling me to meet with the manager/supervisor. After meeting and chatting with the manager, they show you the place and then afterwards, you hand in your resume and they ask some basic questions like where do you see yourself five years from now?
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Manager of Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Huntington, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fine. I met with both the Assistant Director and Director of Food and Nutrition. Both were very cordial and professional  The conversation back and forth was very smooth and easy
Interview Questions: They asked me to describe a difficult situation I had been in and how it was resolved

title: Secretary Non Medical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from HR to come in for a typing test, then I had a brief interview about my goals and expectations.  They said I wasn't interviewing for one job but when a job became available they would call me.  Five months later I got a call for an interview with the department and then about 2 weeks later an offer.
Interview Questions: The most difficult aspect was the medical clearance.  I had my immunizations so long ago, they needed to be updated and although I didn't wait long it was done on my own time.

title: Clinical Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (West Hempstead, NY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with a supervisor at the clinic to interview, and it was more like I was interviewing him. He was impressed by my experience, and told me about the programs in detail. He also introduced me to other staff members and took me on a tour of the agency. I think this was an easy interview because I was just applying to be a social work intern. I've heard that actual staff interviews are much more difficult.
Interview Questions: Why I go into the social work field.

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was laid off due to the company closing, i was sent on an interview through 1199. i was sent to a location on 59th street. the interview was not what i expected the person who interviewed me was occupied with her email. she glanced over at me a few times in between responding to emails, we had a very brief conversation she then sent me to take a typing test after the test she sent me to meet my supervisor at the location where i applied for.
Interview Questions: do i have experience

title: Physician Billing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY)
Interview Descriptions: HR is very professional as they work diligently to fill all open positions listed on the health system's career portal. Overall, the interview process went smoothly. Once you meet with HR, you then move on to interview with the department's hiring manager(s).
Interview Questions: I do not remember the specific questions asked in my interview process, but I don't believe there were unexpected or difficult questions asked. Maybe the most difficult is, "Tell me about yourself."

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: one interview with DON and one with the unit manager very easy going and laid back. interview process took about a week. and another few weeks before the job actually started
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position through college career office. Called for in campus interview. After discussing with interviewer he felt I would be a better fit for Financial Reporting side of hospital as opposed to the tax side. He forwarded my resume and didn't hear back from them until a month later. Setup a 1 on 1 interview and was asked to explain current duties at employer, go through my resume, why am I looking for leave my current position. They did have me meet with 3 different managers which one would think that's a good thing but clearly its just their process to weed out candidates.
Interview Questions: Assessment of skills

title: Junior Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview (3 people), very relaxed. She asked a question and we went around answering it. I think there were about 5. It was pretty quick, too. If you get to the interview round, you're gonna be a volunteer. The interview is just a formality. You just have to complete all the other requirements like the application, working papers if under 18, health clearance.
Interview Questions: What was something I worked really hard to accomplish and ended up accomplishing?

title: Volunteer Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: If they are interested in you as an applicant, they will ask you to come in for an interview. There, an academic associate will usually be there to hold the interview for you. The interview lasted for about 15 minutes, and after that they will tell you most likely that they will get back to you within a couple of weeks with their decision.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself and your background?

title: Hostess Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went on four interviews. One with the union, one with the talent team, one with the assistant director and another with the talent team to discuss the decision. During the union you fill out paper work based on the job you are seeking, they search positions that fit your wants and call you when they are ready to set up an interview with the talent team. Once you have your interview with the talent team they basically test you out to see if you are a good fit to send to the employer. If they decide you are they send you to the employer. You interview with the supervisor then the assistant director. Once you are finished you wait for the talent team to call you and tell you whether or not you have been hired. If you are hired you go to the talent team and discuss your pay, benefits, and beginning date. They send you to the hospital where you are drug tested fully, mouth , blood, and urine. Once you pass you are given a start date.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Each individual personalizes their experience and question.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position and was contacted right away to meet with someone. I later met with the hiring manager. They asked very basic questions. They asked me to come back and complete a typing test. Once that was done, I was told to come back once again to meet with another manager. I then met up with the other manager who took all my information. Lastly, I went  through a VERY LONG period of training and was finally hired.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous job experiences

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter. I passed the initial phone interview. The next step was a panel interview with 5 members of the finance department including the senior financial analyst. The interview went well where I asked questions and answered all their inquiries. I sent an email after the interview to thank everyone involved. To this day I haven't heard anything from LIJ Health System.
Interview Questions: One thing you would like to change about your last job

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Great Neck, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I am a current employee at NSLIJ and was looking to transfer to another department within the company.  A position became available and tried to apply. Over 6 weeks ago I was interviewed over the phone for the position for over 45 minutes.  I was told repeatedly that I was the only one being considered for the position, but nothing was ever confirmed.  I was finally called back 2 days ago to come in for a formal interview with 3 additional people.  Since so much time had passed since my initial interview, however, I applied for several positions outside the Health System and am about to accept an offer.  Needless to say, I am very disappointed and frustrated in the way my interview at NSLIJ was handled.  The ironic part of the situation is that I am interviewing for a position in the HR department!!
Interview Questions:
How often am I late to work?  
How often do I call in sick?

title: Billing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: interviewed with director of program.  I got the interview through an employee referral.  I met with the director of the program and we had a very casual meeting.  I was very positive, upbeat and told her that  was very interested in the job because I valued the work they do there.
Interview Questions: why would i want to work there?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Human Resource interview followed by hiring manager interview.  Usually internal referral required. If you are not applying for a clinical position, you probably wont have to answer any experience questions
Interview Questions: Typical scenario questions.  If you had to blank how would you respond.  ETC

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter emailed me to call their office to discuss my credentials for a Medical Technologist part time position.  I called the recruiter, but the phone went to voicemail. I left two voicemails but no one has gotten back to me.  Since they're recruiting, shouldn't they try calling me?  It's a weird process of recruiting going on.
Interview Questions: None since the recruiter hasn't gotten back to me.

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions:
Round1- Phone interview
Round2- In-person interview: mainly behavioral questions; 4 different groups (each with 4-5 people)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Various, Non-clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
After filling out a very long and detailed online application, which mirrors the information in the resume you are submitting, you have to fill in another paper application, with all of the same information on your online application and resume when you arrive for the interview.  The interviews themselves are fine.  The wheels fall off after the fact.
