I applied for several jobs over the course of two years of unemployment.  I interviewed for three or four different positions during that time.  Each time I had multiple rounds of interviews.  The process took weeks, months.  I would talk to the NSLIJ recruiter a couple of times a week.  Then, when it got down to the bitter end...silence.  Suddenly calls were not returned.  Emails were not returned.  No rejection, just completely ignored.  I think I got a proper rejection letter only once, about 9 months after my last interview.

About 6 months ago, I was called out of the blue by a recruiter about a new job.  Against my better judgement, given how discourteously I had been treated, I agreed to a phone interview the next day.  I am now working again and set time aside from my schedule for it.  The recruiter finally called an hour after we had agreed to speak with a vague, "Oh sorry, got pulled away."  I told him I was no longer interested in the position.  A wise person once said, "If they treat you badly during the interview process, imagine how badly they'll treat you once you work there."
Interview Questions: Everyone always asked how I handled conflict.  After a while I got the feeling there was a lot of conflict that needed resolving in the workplace at NSLIJ

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume online and received a form email from HR saying that I was selected for a phone interview.  It told me to call the HR person at my convenience.  I called and left a VM which was never returned.  I called 4 days later and left another VM which was never returned.  Highly unprofessional.  Even if they called me at this point, I wouldn't pursue this opportunity.  Their loss.
Interview Questions: none since they don't return calls to actually have an interview with them!

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to manhattan for an interview with the recruiter. the interview went well and he sent me to the actual hospital (Lenox hill) to interview with the director. The director felt my good energy and was ready for me to start in no time.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work with us, what can you bring

title: Nutritionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not possible to speak to a person except during very limited "chat" hours. Person answering phone has no information available on specific jobs that are posted. Cannot tell you the location or building and stated an incorrect department. No salary information available. Sent on an interview and the manager was not there, after waiting an hour I was told she would need to reschedule. The following week a very poor interview was given. No salary information available again. No disposition email sent to advise whether position was filled or not.
Interview Questions: No questions even asked!

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews. One with HR. Second interview with direst manager. I followed up a couple of times after not hearing from them. Was told no decision has been made. Four months later still haven't heard anything.  Didn't get much warm and fuzzy feeling out of it. I think they handle so many applicants that it gets boring for them.
Interview Questions: Nothing asked of me that was out of the ordinary. They usually ask one or two behavior questions.

title: MIS User Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: communication was great with hiring staff and interview was streamlined and Hr staff keep contact every step of the way. All staff was prompt and courteous. Interview was professional but relaxed.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Associate Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY)
Interview Descriptions: First interview with HR, then direct supervisor and final round with head of the department.
Interview Questions: Do you work well with physicians who are highly stressed and can be curt?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwell Health
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview at first, then a face to face interview for the first round. Made it past the first round, then met with 10+ people in groups of 2-3 for second round. Basic fit questions, and they wanted to make a point to ask the same questions each time. A couple of the interviewers seemed like they did not want to be there, so that was kind of off-putting.

All in all, not a bad place, most people were nice enough. Dont think I would have taken the job even if I did get it.
Interview Questions: Had to do a 45-Minute Excel Test.. If you did not know excel, you would fail

title: Psych Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with the creative arts director. She asked me a lot of relevant questions to the position. She asked me a lot about my interest in working with individuals with mental illness and about my previous coursework relevant to this topic.
Interview Questions: How would you feel about running groups?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview by medical director.  Couldn't tell how it went.  Interviewer never contacted me one way or another.  At my level, I consider a follow up mandatory.  Job is still being advertised six months later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Dental Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application via PASS, waited for reply for interview date. The interview period was over a 5-day time span, and the program directors/attendings sat in for a round table interview with every applicant
Interview Questions: What was the last book you read and why did you read it?

title: Trainer-AEHR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR department and proceeded to meet with the Director and Training Manager. Everyone was very welcoming and professional. Questions were direct and to the point. The Director requested a formal training presentation the following week. Subject matter was at the discretion of the applicant. Presentation was given in front of five representatives of the department.
Interview Questions: Standard questions experienced.

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was some what difficult. Meet with Supervisor and VP. New program for the company.
Interview Questions: What's my experience in medical field?

title: Various Positions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went to NSLIJ for several interviews for different positions. I interviewed with one of the recruiters and she liked me so she ask me to come back and interview with the head of the department for the particular job. I did they had already decided on who they wanted for the position before I got there. They had me waiting for over 2 hours and after I complained called me back to speak with the department manager. She loved me put indicated that she had already found who she wanted and wished she had interviewed me before. My first encounter with the human resource department was for a Secretary position when they were suppose to get back to me and never did. I followed up with thank you letters and call backs and I never received any correspondents. They need to do better in HR Department. I am so hesitant to apply for anything thing else and this is 2 years later because you can not trust their recruiters the entire department needs to be revamped.
Interview Questions: The interviewer was reading from a list of questions. She only asked me to describe an instance at work where you had to take the initiative in a situation. She asked me the same question twice also, I would think depending on your title you are interviewing for the recruiter could come up with some job related questions. She asked if I had any questions and I did she was surprised.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: 3 step process. it was lengthy had to do two phone interviews. And then was later called to do two presentations in person. A small workshop and design my own topic with Assessment and Evaluation.
Interview Questions: Several questions. Is there a question we did not ask, what is it and how would you answer

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Came in with a resume they asked me why i wanted to volunteer, to tell them about myself etc. 
Second was the orientation where they spoke about hygiene and how important it is to keep a safe environment. Lastly they gave our our volunteer assignments.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about yourself.

title: Senior Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Great Neck, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial application had to be online through company portal.  Then had initial phone screen with HR recruiter followed by more edxtensive in-person HR interview.  Approximately one month later, I met with the Hiring Manager followed by a second Hiring Manager interview immediately followed by one with the Department Chair
Interview Questions: Tolerance for fast pace

title: Senior Pediatric Pharmacist/Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted 5 days after applying, set up an interview and was offered a position within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Straight forward required interviewer questions.Paperwork, applications, References, Job History, Finger Printing for New York State when working with Children.

title: Specialist IDX Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with previous director, Sharon. She was very pleasant and it made me feel it was more of an open discussion about the job duties and applications to be supported. Little did I know that she was actually testing me on my knowledge of the job duties. The director had unofficially offered me the position on the spot and I was given the official word a couple days later. Its a shame they fired her after 34 years of service.
Interview Questions: What are some of the computer programs that you have worked with?

title: Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Great Neck, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I felt that the phone interview went fairly well but the woman I spoke with did not respond to my thank you e-mail at all. I waited about 6 weeks and then contacted the admin who had scheduled the interview. Had to e-mail her twice before the woman with whom I had interviewed finally got back to me. They had already offered the job to an internal candidate which was very dissapointing. I felt that they could have responded to me in a more timely manner. A simple e-mail note stating that they had filled the position would have been fine, just didn't feel that there was any need to keep me on the line for as long as they did.

Also, and this is a critique of the "equal opportunity emloyment" policies in general, I am profoundly tired of interviewing for positions that have already been ear-marked for internal candidates. I am almost tempted to inquire in my next interview whether or not I am actually being considered as a candidate for the job or if they are simply conducting interviews with external candidates to maintain their equal opportunity employer status. I don't think that they can legally not post the job (despite its essentially already having been filled) but it is a very unfair system to job seekers, especially in these tough economic times.
Interview Questions: What do you consider to be the top three problems facing healthcare today?

title: Technical Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line and receive a call about 1 week later to setup an interview.  The person that called couldn't really give me any additional information...(I have 10 years of recruiting experience and wanted to may sure they were looking for a really recruiter not someone to post jobs and sit back and wait).  The interview it self was focused on branding and promoting the NSLIJ system as opposed to finding out if I could do the job.
Interview Questions: No question were difficult more generic type questions.  I could tell I wasn't a fit for them, the interviewers kept harping on the fact that there was a straight base and no commissions (I was coming from the agency side) and that they probably couldn't pay me the same as I was earning.

title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online directly to a job posting.  Got a phone call around 6.15pm a few nights later and spent about 40 minutes on the call.  I got the impression the recruiter was reading from a script of questions because she asked me the same question twice.  When I said she already asked me that question she said she needed more information.  When I gave an answer to the question she said “oh yea, I did ask you that one already”.  Despite her telling me that I would definitely hear from her again I never did and that was almost three months ago.  It’s so easy to communicate with candidates through Applicant Tracking Systems these days.  A simple “ thanks, but no thanks” email just takes one click.  So a tumbs down for professional courtesy at NSLIJ.
Interview Questions: How many people have you managed?

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
1. HR will call you to set up an interview a manager for the department you are applying for.

2. Than HR will call you to set up an interview with them. Sometimes they will offer you the job right there but other times they might interview further candidates.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Administrative Assistant to Emergency Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was very easy
Interview Questions: Where will you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: They asked me about research that I included on my resume. They asked about my experience and gave me a unit tour and introduced me to staff. They asked if I am interested in continuing my education. They asked why I chose my nursing specialty and what qualities I bring to it.
Interview Questions: How did you incorporate evidence based practice into your work?

title: AP Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I came in as a temporary employee and was hired by the hospital. I did not have a typical interview.
I worked as a temp for 8 months and was then hired full time with benefits. The department was fun to work in .
Interview Questions: How are you with excel?

title: CDI Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Began with Skype interview as I lived in Chicago during the interview/hiring process. Initial interview was via Skype with one CDI Director and the HIM Director. Then in person interview a couple weeks later at their corporate HQ in Westbury, with 1 HR employee and 2 CDI directors. Very benign questions about my experience and how I performed CDI at my prior job, etc...then hired a couple weeks later; all done through a recruiter.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nursing Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (North Nassau, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Clinical exam. Interviewed with an Asst Director. Interviewed with 2nd Asst Director. I interviewed with a Director for a promotion. It was a pleasant interview. I eventually interviewed for an administrative position. This interview was somewhat more challenging. I was asked about a number of rather tough scenarios, and then had a panel interview with my would-be peers.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose North Shore

title: Food Service Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was real easy going, women was really nice to me. lasted about 20-30 mins. the waiting time for the interview time was a little longer then expected but nothing crazy.
Interview Questions: Name a time I had to go above and beyond

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Provided me with a proposal, addresses PTO, salary...
A proposal was offered to me, if I wanted it. I needed to give an immediate answer, no negotiations...
There was no give and take, there was a list of pre recs for the job. I handed over my legal documents and had to pass a drug test and a background check...
Interview Questions:
No questions on what I have to offer.
I was presented an offer, take it or leave it!
There was no back and forth, there was no dialog.
This is a proposal, this is what we offer, do you want it??  Next....
That's how my interview went, so I can't give an example of a question.

title: CHHA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Waited too long for phone screen.  Met with Senior Management, Nursing Staff and leadership.  Dropped off several resumes during waiting period due to new staff at Human Resources greeting desk.  They were extremely busy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to provide care to patients?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Took a while from when first applied.  Phone interview with HR, followed by interview with the team (including the vp), offer was received shortly after the team interview, negotiation took a day or two, offer came within the next week, background check and other formalities took another week or so, they usually like to start mid month or the beginning of the month unless the role demands an immediate pressing need
Interview Questions: Why NS

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Difficult person
Interview Questions: Technical and critIcal question

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Bay Shore, NY) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Disjointed, poor communication between director and human resources
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses ?

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Lake Success, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: recruiter asked questions from a worksheet- I didnt get a good vibe of company. she did not respond to my thank you e-mail, which is rude.
Interview Questions: what was the most difficult situation you had to deal with at work so far?

title: Psychiatry Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Glen Oaks, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straight-forward. I went to corporate HR first, filled out paperwork, and was interviewed by one of their staff.  The questions asked were pretty standard-- work history, career goals, etc.  After that staff member approved me I met with the doctor who would be my direct supervisor.  He didn't ask me too many questions, but instead mainly described the studies that I would be working on.
Interview Questions: I really wasn't asked any difficult or unexpected questions, granted I had come prepared to answer any common interview questions.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Westbury, NY) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: First step was an on campus 1:1 interview with a finance department representative.  Then came the phone interview with an HR manager.  Then an interview day consisting of 5 interviews with various managers and directors along with a VP of finance.  That day there was an Excel test as well consisting of vlookups and sumifs.  The managers and directors kept telling me about their IT systems and you were expected to retain at least some of the information and regurgitate it back to the next interview.
Interview Questions: Which department do you see yourself fitting in most and what skills do you possess that will assist you?

title: Nurse Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (New Hyde Park, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Took about a year for them to contact me but I finally got an interview. First step, take a basic math and english test. 2nd, take a scenario interview. I got fingerprinted then off I went to my third interview with my manager. It was quick and easy then I got interviewed by two employees. It took about a week then I got a call back to say that i was hired. I went to a welcome luncheon, then went to training. It was a lot of work but worth it.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient was aggressive and you had to speak with a doctor and answer the phone at the same time?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwell Health (Manhasset, NY) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions:
William Randolph Hearst Critical Care Nursing Fellowship

1) first interview with 'talent acquisition' - formal interview @ HR with standard interview questions for nursing including "do a verbal physical exam on a cardiac patient"

2) meet with nurse manager on the floor for which you are interviewing (for example, MICU, SICU). Generally, less formal bc it is conducted on a busy floor with the happenings of the unit in the background

3) meet with the educator staff of the Patient Safety Institute, where the first semester of fellowship is conducted. This was a formal interview setting, and they probed to see if you were willing to make the two year commitment to NSLIJ if offered acceptance into the fellowship
Interview Questions: What were the challenges of the most difficult case you've been involved in?
